May 3, 1961
Dr. Harry J. Skornla
1015 West Church Street
Champaign, Illinois
Dear Harry:
Today I stopped In at the "Ask Mr. Foster" travel service and asked
Mrs. Adams, who took car of our trip, to write you about accomodations ,
sailing dates, rates, etc. She also picked out a handful of brochures
to send along.
I honestly think the small cottage owned by Gilbert Cooper, about
which I told you, would be well-suited. It's small, but cozy; hidden
In a grove of trees, but right on the brtnk of a cliff overlooking the
ocean.
As I told you,,there are many luxurious hotels. The Bermudlana, where
we stayed for a while, Is new and well situated with reference to
downtown Hamilton stores, bars, movies, etc. Three hotels that I am
sure you would not like are: Castle Rock, Belmont Harbor, and the
Princess. They are huge, agresslveiy exuberant, and peopled by portions
of our affluent society with compulsions toward exlbltlontstlc recreation.
I feel confident that you will have a wonderful time there and If you are
both good sailors I would strongly recommend your going by boat. It's
a pleasant voyage (unless you run Into storms) and Jewell and I enjoyed
It very much on our second honeymoon ten years ago.
Cordially yours.
WGH:rkf
William G. Harley
President
